column1: full and some shape into the left-hander. Clips the pad as Carey looks for a flick
short and wide, slashes a cut through the covers. That's a gift for a new batsman,or for any batsman
full in the corridor of uncertainty. Left alone
short of a length, shapes into the left-hander slightly and drifts down the leg side
edged and past the first slip fielder. Gets some prodigious movement off the seam and gets it to kick up slightly more than expected from a slightly short of a length to have him all squared up

back of a length on off, drops it into the point region and the fielder runs in, dives forward and nails a direct hit with one stump in vicinity but the batsman has made his ground. Good cricket all around
back of a length, drops to mid-off for a quick single
good length, slight shape away from him outside off, punched through the gap at covers
short and wide, swings hard and slaps it over point. Too much width
full and angling in on off, pushed down the ground and mid-on gets around it with a slide
full outside off, driven wide of mid-off for a very quick single
back of a length on off, defended back
back of a length outside off, pushes forward and the ball comes into him to find the inside edge and run into the leg side
full toss, driven hard to the off side. Can't find the gap
full and loopy on middle and leg, whipped uppishly towards mid-on
stays in the crease and opens the face of his bat but is tucked up as the ball slides into him. Gets an inside edge that lands in front of the stumps
fuller, drilled hard to mid-off
fullish on middle and leg, nudged into the square leg region for one
full and angling in on leg, turned away to backward square leg
full and angled across well outside off, driven away
what a shot! Ho ho.. Just presents the full face of the bat to this fuller delivery that's angled across him and chips it with superb timing well over mid-off
full and around the same line again. This time he has hammered a straight drive, to the left of mid-off. Shot
short of a length, pitches outside leg, tucked to midwicket for one

edged and taken. Sandhu provides the breakthrough with an off-cutter that bounces more than expected. Tight line outside off, so draws the batsman forward and forces him to play at it. Because of the lack of pace, the edge doesn't quite carry but does well to compensate for that by diving forward to take the catch
fullish on the stumps, defended down the pitch
loops up a full toss at 105kmph, hurriedly punched down the ground. Does well to control it
full and sliding on leg, clipped to mid-on where McClenaghan dives to his left and stops it
advances down the ground for a big heave and gets an inside edge that foes along the ground o the leg side
full toss, angled in at leg stump, pushed back and Green dives to his right to make a clean stop with his outstretched right hand
punched into the off side

lots of loop and flight. Giving the room absolutely no room to open up. Choking him with tight lines. Another leg-stumpish full slider that's been pushed out down the pitch. Top over. Thunder nicely building pressure here
good length on middle, defended
short and wide, slashes out a punch to point where Ferguson makes a diving stop
fullish length outside off, and a crisp drive through the covers. Has split cover and point with precision here
back of a length on middle and off, defended
fullish, outside off, gets some shape away and finds the outside edge to short third man
short of a length on middle and leg, tucked between mid-on and midwicket. There are two fielders closing in and they still take them on for a rapid second run
length, spins away towards off, eased down to long-on
fuller delivery, whipped wide of long-on
slides across a flighted legbreak well outside off, whipped away towards midwicket from outside off
fullish length around the leg stump channel, gets down for a sweep and beats short fine leg diving to his right. Makes a clumsy effort to get down
drilled hard down the ground
shortish, it's the googly and spins the other way, lets it come on before dabbing it towards point
fullish on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
some spin away from the left-hander, slashes a cut through the covers
comes slightly down the ground but the bowler follows him outside the leg-stump. Misses an attempted flick and the ball lobs behind the stumps off the pad
comes down again and this time meets the pitch to drive to long-off
comes down the track and tries to heave, gets it down to wide long-on off the inside of the bat
flat back of a length, punched to long-on from front of leg stump

loses shape as he comes down the ground and lofts this one. Probably because of the drift. Seemed a bit too sharp. It was the right length but he was opened up slightly because of the ball going away from him and skewed it off the splice to hole out to long-on
a flat length ball, gets down for a sweep but cannot middle it
this time it's the right length to be playing that shot. Full and enough room, a slog sweep through midwicket

superb catch at long-on Or is it?. Gets down for another slog but this time the ball's been slanted across more sharply to him, leaving him to fetch it from outside off. Skews it off the splice of the bat to long-on. But there is lot of power so it still carries quite a distance. The fielder takes it reverse-cupped but was moving back and as the momentum carries him towards the ropes, he throws the ball in the air, steps out, comes back into the field of play and completes the catch. But he didn't release the ball in time. Still a good effort

a poor shot. Goes for a flick which was a poor shot to begin with as it's against the turn, especially with the ball slanted across. But this one's a googly which spins in to beat the inside edge and take out off-stump
flicked into the leg side, behind square
fuller ball on the pads, clipped off them to the on side
full and pushed across around middle, eased down to long-off
full outside off, driven to the right of cover

shout for leg before, not given. Gets down for a sweep, the ball curves into him to beat the shot and hit him on the pad. Seems to have pitched in line and hit him in front of middle and leg. But the umpire thinks otherwise
fuller, eased down to long-off
fuller, uses the drift and turn to nail a sweep behind square for four
back of a length, spins the other way - it's the wrong'un - punched to the cover region
another sweep behind square. Too full on the pads, just gets down and helps it on its way through the backward square leg region
shifts across to make room and cuts a short of a length delivery through cover and point
googly that spins the other way from a back of a length, cut to cover who misfields
full outside off, driven through cover
spins in to middle, pushed to mid-on who dives and makes a save
walks across to get behind the line and tucks a length ball to square leg
flat, back of a length, tucked wide of long-on
fullish length, meets the pitch with a stride across off before getting down and sweeping through the square leg region
short and wide, cut to deep point
short of a length, pushed across off and spins in, defended down the pitch
gets down to sweep to the wrong length, not full enough, doesn't middle it
loops up and gets it to dip at a very full length, dug out
full and tight on the stumps, drilled back to the bowler
backs away and the bowler follows him by looping it into him, drilled to long-on
short but not wide enough, backs away and makes room before cutting out to deep point
short of a length outside off, defended back
full and wide, gets forward for a drive and the ball comes into him to take the inside edge between midwicket and mid-on

oh, what a shot! That's a stunning shot. This is a pretty good delivery, very tight on middle, for starters. But Ingram has walked across a long way outside off, made it a leg-stumpish delivery and heaved it off the pads over backward square leg
short and wide, slashes at it and skews it down the pitch off the toe-end of the bat
gets an inside edge onto the pad as the ball goes to cover-point
innovative. Gets in position for a scoop over the keeper's head. Sees the line and instead does a reverse scoop through the off side to third man

backs away a long way across and exposes all three stumps. Fawad has followed him with a pretty full delivery. What's worse, it doesn't spin as much. Wells slashes at it with a flat bat and makes no contact. Nowhere near it
full outside off, googly, presses forward and defends
attempted sweep, inside-edged on to the pad
tries to force a cut to this shortish delivery and gets beaten for pace as it spins away outside off
fullish, well outside off, gets down for a slog and does not make good timing as the ball goes down between long-on and midwicket
comes down the track and eases a fuller ball down to long-off
back of a length, pitching outside leg, punched down the pitch
minimal turn outside off, so he is tucked up but he tries to cut to point and chops it
flat length ball on middle and leg, turned away to the vacant gap at midwicket. Vats open spaces

advances down the ground to give himself all the room he needs. Perhaps went away from the ball a bit too much so he doesn't middle it too well. Heaves it straight over with power and it just about carries over the long-on fielder leaping back with one hand outstretched
short of a length, not much room, looks for a slap and is beaten by the lack of pace
short and wide, still not wide enough, and this time he's beaten by pace as the ball climbs over the flashing blade at pace
short ball, again considerable bounce beats the attempted hook
full, angling in on off, drills it down to long-on
full, pushed across, slashes away from the body and skews it in the air off the bottom of the bat. Point runs back but the ball lands in front of him
back of a length, punched to cover
shot. Backs away and crunches it over long-off as Green loops one into his off-stump

yorker! Hits the boot but the ball was angling into him so the lbw appeal is withheld. Ingram jams the bat down but it's nowhere near the ball. They take the leg bye as the ball goes into the off side
length ball, slanted across from around the wicket. A negative line. Launched straight over
slants it across again. It's a poor delivery, to be honest. Short. But it's fired a lot wider and that results in the ball finding the bottom of the bat as the ball lobs in the air to point
full and angling into him sharply to tuck him up, drills it out through the off side after backing away
full ad angling in, clipped to the gaps at square leg for a brace
short ball, lots of room, swivels around and pulls from outside off. Wristy as he dispatches it well over square leg with imperious timing
full, slanted across, to far away
short and wide, skiddy, cuts to sweeper cover
back of a length, angled across, slaps out to deep point
comes down the track but the bowler has taken it away from him by pushing it across and has him beaten
oh, dear! Rashid walks across for a slog, makes no contact, and tumbles across and falls over, much to the amusement of the bowler and the fielders
slower fullish length ball and wide at 110kmph, slashes away from the body and gets the edge as it bounces slightly
oho! Rashid gets down and across for a slog, makes no contact, loses balance and tumbles over, much to the amusement of Buttler and the rest of the Thunder

miscommunication on the second run. Short ball, pulled through the square leg umpire who has to do a bit of a high jump to gets out of the way and Lehmann wants the second. Rashid says no. Lehmann runs and runs, and continues to all the way until they're both at the same end
tries to heave this delivery and skews it in the air off the splice. Drops in no man's land at deep fine leg
length ball, angling on middle and leg, gets the front leg out and shovels it awkwardly to midwicket
lots of width outside off, Rashid sees that after shuffling across and lets it go
oh, shot! That's an imperious hit. Comes down the track to this length ball and makes some room before launching him over long-off
short and wide, shuffles across and tries to ramp it over the keeper. Makes no contact
shot. In his swinging arc and that's outta here! A half-volley outside off and Rashid swings clean to dispatch it well over cow corner
full, wide, pushed into the covers
full, drifts across a long way and Patterson tries to put his bat down and makes no contact
fullish length, turned away to the left of the bowler
short of a length, outside edge down to third man as he flashes away from the body
short of good length, pitches outside leg, swivels around and pulls past the short fine leg fielder
back of a length, pitches outside leg, keeps a little low and beats his flick to hit the pad. Optimistic appeal for lbw
back of a length, angled across off, again keeps a little low, crunched to covers on the front foot
fullish outside off, pushed towards mid-off uppishly
short and wide, chops a cut to point
short of a length, gets him to fish in the corridor of uncertainty and beats the outside edge
short ball, sways out of the line as the ball climbs around the off-stump channel
full and angled in at middle and leg, heaved over midwicket for a brace
short of a length, cuts in sharply, defended down the pitch
full, pitching outside leg, pushed out wide of midwicket
fuller outside off, drilled hard to mid-on
tries to flick from outside off, this one curves in from outside off and hits the pad before lobbing into the off side. Impact may have been outside
dropped. Mid-off drips a dolly as Patterson chips a drive to this fullish length ball. Bends forward and cups his hands but it bursts out after thudding into them
half-volley outside off, Buttler smokes it straight over for a clean and straight six over long-off
full on middle and off, looks for a flick across the line and gets an inside edge to the pad
shortish, swivels around for a pull but there is no room and the ball misses off-stump by inches as it beats the bat and goes to the keeper
full, pushed across on off, drilled to mid-on
short ball, pulled behind square leg, deep fine leg sprints across but gets nowhere near it
shovels this over midwicket. A length ball outside off, simply heaves it with muscle for four
gets down and across for a scoop but the ball has drifted down the leg side
fullish length outside off, pushes away from the body and gets a thick outside edge to third man
full, outside off, crunched to covers
in the air and short of backward point. Slices a cut to this short and wide ball, no control
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
tries to force a cut despite minimal room and gets beaten
ugly shot through the covers but effective. Instead of getting towards the delivery, he takes the front leg out and away from it before crunching it uppishly but through the gap
now that's more elegant. Makes room and eases a punch through the gap again at covers for an authoritative boundary
short of a length and a bit of width, chops a cut to point
walks forward to a fuller ball and drives to the covers
short of a length on off, punched to cover and point region
slower short ball, can't get on top of the bounce and gets beaten as he slashes. Beaten by a thorough lack of pace
length ball on off, drops to cover
aaaand... he gets a maiden. A rare one in the BBL. Reaps the rewards for tight, accurate bowling. This one's full around middle and is clipped out to midwicket
full on middle, clipped with the turn to deep midwicket
short, straightening around off, backs away and punches through the covers
clears the front leg and crunches a fuller ball but straight to mid-off
walks across to get close to the line of a back of a length ball and pulls it away behind square leg

bowled him. Rashis strikes. And it's with the wrong'un. Loops it up to Buttler who jams the bat down but doesn't pick the variation. The ball spins into him and may have got an inside edge before clattering into the stumps
lures him forward with a fuller one in the corridor and gets it to spin subtly away from him, leaving him narrowly beaten
back of a length, pitches on leg, wants to tuck but gets an inside edge to the thigh guard as the ball goes to square leg
fuller, crunches a drive to mid-off
full and curving in, misses the flick and hits the pad of Watson. Stifled appeal for lbw. Would have gone down leg
raps the pad from a back of a length, looks to flick without any room but it pitched well outside leg
short of a length outside off, stays in the crease and opens the face to third man
full on leg stump, pushed down to long-on
short and spinning in, backs away and punches through the covers
full and flat on off, leans forward and eases it down to long-on
skips out and goes for an inside-out drive through the covers. It's against the turn and he gets an inside edge behind square
full, clipped off the pads to midwicket for a quick run. The fielder dives and throws but a direct hit would have had him out by a mile.
short and mimimal turn outside off, stabs to backward point
short of a length, down the leg side, misses the batsman's attempted tuck
full on middle and leg, pushed back down the pitch
fuller, angles it across slightly more on middle and off, pushed out to cover
length ball, flicked from around off to deep midwicket
slower full ball, jams the bat down for a drill to long-on
length ball, pitches outside leg, presents the full face of the bat to cover
short of a length, pulled away to midwicket
short, not much room, tries to manufacture some but it isn't enough and he chops the cut to cover

is that a drop? Carey's suggestion seems to suggest so. This was short of a length and strangled Patterson down the leg side. He gets a feather, a glove, to Carey who gets down to his right and spills it
short, muscles a pull to the left of deep midwicket
full outside off, crunches a drive to mid-off
short of good length, gets a glove again as he tries to pull behind square but this time it drops into the ground on its way to the keeper

oh, dear! He must be feeling hard done by. He's been trying the pull for a while now but wasn't middling it. Now he finally flays it bang off the middle but has picked out deep backward square leg who gets across to his left and snaffles it easily in front of the boundary
short of a length, pulls out to deep midwicket
short of good length, cuts into him, pulled to deep backward square leg
back of a length on off, punched to point
short of a length, no pace outside off, slapped to point
short of a length, pulled to deep midwicket
full and wide, swing and a miss outside off
short of a length around off, Watson gets on top of the bounce and crunches a pull through deep midwicket, comfortably beats the fielder diving to his right
goes for a big heave over the leg side and carves it away to square leg off the inside edge
slower-ball full toss, flicked to deep midwicket
full, wide, crunched through the cover and point region
full, curving in on off, dug out down the pitch to long-on
full toss on middle and off, that's a gift but Thunder are looking a gift horse in the mouth here. Tries to swat it away and goes too hard at it, dragged down to long-on. Straight to the fielder

top catch at long-on Lack of pace again does the batsman in. Watson fetches a pull from outside off but he has to muster all the power he can to clear the boundary. He does but it still doesn't suffice. Lehmann at the boundary moves back and takes it reverse-cupped, sees the momentum taking him over, releases the ball, steps out, steps back into the field of play and completes it. Tell you what, he made it look like the simplest of catches but he really had to be wary of the boundary. He was inches away from it
full, pushed down to long-off for one
fullish length around off, whips it into the midwicket region for one
comes down the track and the bowler follows him and drags the length back. The batsman gets tucked up and manages to get hit on the thigh guard
goes through with a pull early but it's slow again and he gets no decent connection to fine leg
short of a length, backs away and swings big but there is no room and he misses
full and well wide of him, crunches it out to sweeper cover
full and angling down leg, tries to clip it out and gets hit on the pad to short fine leg
short of good length, pulled to deep backward square leg
short ball, can't get on top of the bounce as he tries to ramp it over
fuller delivery, uses the incoming angle to launch it over the region between mid-on and midwicket. A couple of bounces over the boundary. Nobody there
catching practice at short fine leg. Slower short ball, bounces too much for his comfort and he ekes out a top-edge
short of a length, some width, opens the face to run it down to third man
slower at 112ks, dipping fuller ball outside off, heaved through deep midwicket
slower short ball, pulled on the bounce to deep midwicket
back of a length, pitches outside leg, tucked to the midwicket region and they come charging back for the second. Direct hit could have had him back as he dives
wide dipping yorker, jams the bat down to squeeze it out and makes no contact
beats everyone. Googly, Nair tries to slog it out of here and makes no contact as the ball spins into him to tuck him up. Misses leg stump and the keeper doesn't pick it as well
goes for a slog again and this time he makes connection. But it's not good enough. Picks out deep midwicket who takes a good low catch with the ball dying on him
short ball, spins into him, backs away and cuts to the covers
googly, tucked with the spin to deep midwicket
spinning in from a length, tries to make room and knocks it to point
short of a length ball, a little turn around off, drilled back
short ball, drifts away outside off and beats the pull
short ball again, sitting up nicely and Rohrer swivels around and pulls it well over deep square leg
full, in his swinging arc as it's pushed across his off-stump. Stays leg side of it and launches it over long-on
a hat-trick of sixes! Can the Thunder still get back into this? Full and angling into him. helps it on its way over backward square leg with a well-timed flick
that has been absolutely smoked. Tremendous power. Wide fuller ball, hammered over mid-off and a couple of bounces over the ropes this time
another shortish ball, doesn't latch onto the pull this time as the ball goes on the bounce to deep square leg
full, pushed across outside off, drilled past a jumping non-striker to long-off
short of a length, slower, drags a mistimed pull to long-on

lucky to get a wicket here. They continue feeding to Rohrer's strengths. Once again a wide half-volley, well within his arc and Rohrer thumps it straight down. But Laughlin takes a superb catch, runs to his right from long-on and gets behind the line perfectly to grab it
slower full ball, well outside off, picked early and heaved over cow corner. Late fightback, but is this going to be enough?
ah, a tame dismissal next ball. That should be the game now. A low full toss, absolutely no pace, tries to heave and chips it to deep midwicket
tries to heave it over and gets a leading edge that lands short of the man running in from sweeper cover
short of good length, gets a bottom edge into the ground as he tries to pull
edged and gone. Doesn't get behind the line. Just clears the front leg and swipes hard at a short of a length ball that's angled across him. Nicked off to the keeper
walks across and swings for a big heave. Slower ball. Beats him
tries a reverse sweep for a full toss and the ball goes to short third man off the pad. And he's been hit plumb in front of middle and off
dipping full toss on off, punched back to Siddle
skips down the track and swings big for a heave over the leg side. But the ball drifts into him and has him beaten
